main event: A ground-radar observation of a single object moving from south to east in Vejle, Jutland, Denmark in December 1954.
interesting points: The observation was made using ground-radar and involved a single unidentified object.
The report mentions confirmation of the observation by L.C. Harrison Field and the involvement of US Air Force officers.
In another report from 1958, two saucer-type objects were observed climbing to sonic speed, confirmed by an officer from USAF.
The 1958 report describes the objects rising from near sea level to sonic speed climb and mentions a government threat level case.
A naval officer with high rank, trained in observation, reported an observation of an object in 1958, which made several stops and starts during a fifteen-minute observation period.
witnesses: US Air Force officers, trained naval officer, and ground-radar observers.
photographs: no photographs mentioned in the report
